dublinCore.dc:title: 116 S724 IS: Temporary Extension of Fentanyl-Related Substances Scheduling Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Booker introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To extend the temporary scheduling order for fentanyl-related substances for 6 months.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Temporary Extension of Fentanyl-Related Substances Scheduling Act.

section.header: Extension of temporary order for fentanyl-related substances
section.text: Section 2 of the Temporary Reauthorization and Study of the Emergency Scheduling of Fentanyl Analogues Act (Public Law 116â€“114; 134 Stat. 103) is amended by striking March 31, 2025 and inserting September 30, 2025.
